member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cNMAFit.Amotry(System.Double[]@,System.Double@,System.Double[]@,System.Double@,System.Int32[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Int32[]@,System.Boolean[]@)

M:SpectroscopyManager.cNMAFit.SimulatedAnnealingAmotry(System.Double[]@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double[]@,System.Double@,System.Double[]@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double,System.Int32[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Int32[]@,System.Boolean[]@)
T:SpectroscopyManager.cNMAFit
member.summary:
A class which implements the Nelder-Mead Algorithm (NMA) fit for non-linear, multidimensional parameter space.
The classic algorithm is extended by: 1) optional simulated annealing of the parameters, 2) optional adaptive Nelder-Mead expansion, reflection and contraction parameters, depending on the dimension of the problem. "Implementing the Nelder-Mead simplex algorithm with adaptive parameters" Fuchang Gao, Lixing Han, Comput Optim Appl, DOI 10.1007/s10589-010-9329-3 http://www.webpages.uidaho.edu/~fuchang/res/ANMS.pdf

member.name: P:SpectroscopyManager.My.Resources.Resources.InterpolationDescription_Akima
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Akima interpolation is a continuously differentiable sub-spline interpolation. It is built from piecewise third order polynomials. Only data from the next neighbor points is used to determine the coefficients of the interpolation polynomial. There is no need to solve large equation systems and therefore this interpolation method is computationally very efficient. Because no functional form for the whole curve is assumed and only a small number of points is taken into account this method does not lead to [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:SpectroscopyManager.My.Resources.Resources.SmoothingDescription_AdjacentAverage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Takes the simple average value between the given number of adjacent datapoints. This filter often boadens and dereases the height of sharp features. E.g. for Kondo-resonances, you should chose a different one..

member.name: P:SpectroscopyManager.My.Resources.Resources.SmoothingDescription_SavitzkyGolay
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to The Savitzky–Golay smoothing filter is a type of filter first described in 1964 by Abraham Savitzky and Marcel J. E. Golay.
The Savitzky–Golay method essentially performs a local polynomial regression (of degree k) on a series of values (of at least k+1 points which are treated as being equally spaced in the series) to determine the smoothed value for each point.
The main advantage of this approach is that it tends to preserve features of the distribution such as relative maxima, minima and width, whi [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.wFolderBrowser.InsertLvi(System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem,System.Windows.Forms.ListView)
member.summary: Given a ListViewItem with a CShItem in its' Tag, and a ListView whose Items all have a CShItem in their Tags, Insert the ListViewItem in its' proper place in the ListView.
member.param: The ListViewItem to be inserted.
The ListView into which the ListViewItem is to be inserted.
member.remarks:
6/11/2012 - better than a Sort when the list is in order.
Will honor any prior Column Sorts.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.wFolderBrowser.ShowCounts
member.summary: Counts files and folders in the current directory.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.wFolderBrowser.MakeSparceLVItem(ExpTreeLib.CShItem)
member.summary: Creates a minimal ListViewItem from the input CShItem
member.param: The CShItem that this ListViewItem represents
member.returns: A ListViewItem with .Tag and .Text filled, with empty SubItems for the balance of the SubItems required by the ListView.
member.remarks: When it is timely to fill the remaining SubItems with data (after BGW2 has completed), call RefreshLvi.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.wFolderBrowser.RefreshLvi(System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads all of a ListViewItem's SubItems with values from the associated CShItem - obtained from the ListViewItem's .Tag. Note that the CShItem's time sensitive values will be set by CShItem using a W32_FindData structure if it finds one in the CShItem's .Tag - as set in this Form by a BackgroundWorker.
member.param: The ListViewItem to be refreshed
If True, Defer the filling of Length and Date information until later (in the BackgroundWorker). If False (the default) fill Length and Date information in this call.
member.remarks: For optimization, depends on BGW2 having filled CSI.W32Data with a W32Find_Data structure which CShItem will use for Length, Attributes, and Date information.

member.name: F:SpectroscopyManager.wFolderBrowser.m_OutOfRange
member.summary: m_OutOfRange is set to True on lv1.MouseLeave (which happens under many circumstances) to prevent the non-ListViewItem specific menu from firing. See Remarks m_OutOfRange is set to False (allowing ContextMenus in lv1), only on lv1.MouseDown when the Right button is pressed. MouseDown only occurs when the Mouse is really over lv1.
member.remarks: If you hold down the right mouse button, then leave lv1, then let go of the mouse button, the MouseUp event is fired upon re-entering the lv1 - meaning that the Windows ContextMenu will be shown if we don't use this flag (from Calum)

member.summary: Reports an exception a central place. This would most likely find a use in Windows smart clients in the AppDomain.CurrentDomain.UnhandledException handler and the Application.ThreadException handler
member.param: The exception
The logic that takes care of actually reporting the error to the place you want it
User comments about the error

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cBugReporter.GetSystemInfo
member.summary: Creates a System-Information File. Calls the MSINFO32.exe and generates a nfo file. The path of the generated file is returned.
member.returns: Path of generated msinfo32 report file

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cBugReporter.UnhandledDomainExceptionHandler(System.Object,System.UnhandledExceptionEventArgs)
member.summary: Handler Function of the Bug-Reporter, for catching Unhandled Exceptions of the CLR. Note that in .NET 2.0 unless you set in the app.config file your application will exit no matter what you do here anyway. The purpose of this eventhandler is not forcing the application to continue but rather logging the exception and enforcing a clean exit where all the finalizers are run (releasing the resources they hold)

member.summary: Actual Function that calls the Reporting Function, and takes the exception as an argument.

member.summary: Central Class for a WinForms application to catch any unhandled exception, and send a report to the Author of the Program.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.iFitProcedure.FitAsync(SpectroscopyManager.iFitFunction,System.Double[][],System.Double[])
member.summary: Starts the fit in a background thread. If used after calling fit(lambda, minDeltaChi2, maxIterations), uses those values. The stop condition is fetched from this.stop(). Override this.stop() if you want to use another stop condition.
member.param: The model function to be fitted. The Fit-Parameter in the internal array are used as start-conditions.
The data points in an array, double[0 = x, 1 = y][point index]. Size must be double[2][N].
The weights, normally given as: weights[i] = 1 / sigma_i^2. If you have a bad data point, set its weight to zero. If the given array is null, a new array is created with all elements set to 1.
member.returns: True if new thread could be started. False, if thread was already running.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.iFitProcedure.DirectFit(SpectroscopyManager.iFitFunction,System.Double[][],System.Double[])
member.summary: The default fit. If used after calling fit(lambda, minDeltaChi2, maxIterations), uses those values. The stop condition is fetched from Me.StopCondition. Override Me.StopCondition if you want to use another stop condition. The model function to be fitted. The Fit-Parameter in the internal array are used as start-conditions. The data points in an array, double[0 = x, 1 = y][point index]. Size must be double[2][N]. The weights, normally given as: weights[i] = 1 / sigma_i^2. If you have a bad data point, set its weight to zero. If the given array is null, a new array is created with all elements set to 1.

member.name: P:SpectroscopyManager.cFitSettingPanel.LockFitParametersForMultipleFit
member.summary: This property can be overridden! For multiple-function fit, we have to deactivate the ability to fit also some parameters, such as the YOffset for ALL fit-functions, except the first one. Otherwise the algorithm will optimize them, by pushing e.g. one to the negative, to match another one, which is pushed to the positive offset.

This function does nothing. Override it! It gets called in the end of the export. Use it to add additional settings to the fit-model.
Don't close the writer, or leave open elements. This will break the XML-file.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cFitFunction_BCSBase.BCSFunc(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
M:SpectroscopyManager.cFitFunction_BCSBase.BCSDOSComplex(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
Actual BCS-DOS function, that may have a small imaginary damping factor to smear out the peak structure by life-time effects. Returns similar results, as a Lorentzian convolution! Due to calculation time, you should prefer the imaginary damping factor.
Used before, but is CUDA-incompatible and by approx. 16% slower.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cFitFunction_BCSBase.BCSDOSExpanded(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Actual BCS-DOS function, that may have a small imaginary damping factor to smear out the peak structure by life-time effects. Returns similar results, as a Lorentzian convolution! Due to calculation time, you should prefer the imaginary damping factor.
Function got expanded by Mathematica to avoid the need of complex numbers.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cFitFunction_BCSBase.StepGapFunction(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Function that creates the step gap, instead of a BCS Uses a Sigmoidal Boltzmann distribution.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cNumericalMethods.RenormalizeByDataAcuisitionParameters(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double}@,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Re-gauge dIdV-data by using the usually known data-acuisition-parameters.
RenormalizeByNumbers[dIdVSignalFromLockIn_, Vmod_, SensitivityRange_, AmplifierGain_] := dIdVSignalFromLockIn*SensitivityRange/Vmod/10^(AmplifierGain);

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cNumericalMethods.FitDataToFunction(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double}@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
Returns the Parameters for a Fit of the Target Data to an interpolated Version of the Source-Data using the Fit-Function:
Source = y0 + m * Target
Renormalizes the Values of Target to Source, by trying a Fit of Target in Source, using a Squeez-Factor, and an Offset.

member.summary: Tells the state of the FitThreadWorker.

member.summary: Actual Fit-Function. Must be implemented by the inherited class. It does not have to care about saving back the fit-parameters to the base-class, just put them back to the input-arrays.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cFitProcedure._FitWrapper
member.summary:
Wrapper function that takes care of the initialization of the fit, such as setting times, etc.
It then calls _Fit, that is implemented by the child-class, and afterwards uses calculates the statistics for the fit.

member.summary: Checks if the matrix of weights for each point is a matrix of positive elements. Otherwise it initializes a new matrix and sets each value to 1

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cFitProcedure.CalculateChi2(System.Int32[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Calculates value of the function for given parameter array. Also checks the boundaries of the parameters, and adds a penalty factor, if the parameter value is outside the boundary.

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cFitProcedure.CalculateChi2(System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary:
Calculates value of the function for given parameter array. Also checks the boundaries of the parameters, and adds a penalty factor, if the parameter value is outside the boundary.
Use this for already calculated function values.

member.name: F:SpectroscopyManager.cFitProcedure.PartialDerivativeDelta
member.summary: Delta between the partial derivatives used for calculating the jacobian

member.name: M:SpectroscopyManager.cFitProcedure.CalculateJacobianMatrix(SpectroscopyManager.iFitFunction@,System.Double[][]@,System.Int32[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Int32[]@,System.Boolean,System.Double[]@,System.Double[0:,0:]@)
member.summary:
Create Jacobian Matrix of all partial derivatives of the Fit-Function. UseCenterDifferentiationForJacobian decides, whether center differences will be used. They are more accurate, but require more function evaluations, since for the forward differences the function evaluations already performed before are used.
ONLY CHECKS IF THE JACOBIAN EXISTS (IsNothing). DOES NOT CHECK THE LENGTH OF AN EXISTING ONE!!!
member.returns: Boolean, True, if successfull, false, if Jacobian contains NaN
